content.question: ​Water hyacinth is an invasive plant species found in many lakes that typically grows at a rate of <math alttext="7 percent sign"><semantics><mrow><mn>7</mn><mo>%</mo></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> per day. As part of a study, a scientist introduces a <math alttext="150"><semantics><mn>150</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>-gram sample of water hyacinth into a testing pool. Which of the following functions gives the amount of water hyacinth in the testing pool <math alttext="t"><semantics><mi>t</mi><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> weeks after the sample is introduced? (Note: <math alttext="1"><semantics><mn>1</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> week is <math alttext="7"><semantics><mn>7</mn><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math> days.)

choices.label: ​<math alttext="f open parentheses t close parentheses equals 150 open parentheses 1 plus 0.07 to the power of open parentheses 1 divided by 7 close parentheses end exponent close parentheses to the power of t"><semantics><mrow><mi>f</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>150</mn><msup><mfenced><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mn>0.07</mn><mfenced><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>/</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></mfenced></msup></mrow></mfenced><mi>t</mi></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="g open parentheses t close parentheses equals 150 open parentheses 1.07 to the power of open parentheses 1 divided by 7 close parentheses end exponent close parentheses to the power of t"><semantics><mrow><mi>g</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>150</mn><msup><mfenced><msup><mn>1.07</mn><mfenced><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>/</mo><mn>7</mn></mrow></mfenced></msup></mfenced><mi>t</mi></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="h open parentheses t close parentheses equals 150 open parentheses 1 plus 0.07 to the power of open parentheses 7 close parentheses end exponent close parentheses to the power of t"><semantics><mrow><mi>h</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>150</mn><msup><mfenced><mrow><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><msup><mn>0.07</mn><mfenced><mn>7</mn></mfenced></msup></mrow></mfenced><mi>t</mi></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

​<math alttext="k open parentheses t close parentheses equals 150 open parentheses 1.07 to the power of open parentheses 7 close parentheses end exponent close parentheses to the power of t"><semantics><mrow><mi>k</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>150</mn><msup><mfenced><msup><mn>1.07</mn><mfenced><mn>7</mn></mfenced></msup></mfenced><mi>t</mi></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

content.answer: ​<math alttext="k open parentheses t close parentheses equals 150 open parentheses 1.07 to the power of open parentheses 7 close parentheses end exponent close parentheses to the power of t"><semantics><mrow><mi>k</mi><mfenced><mi>t</mi></mfenced><mo>=</mo><mn>150</mn><msup><mfenced><msup><mn>1.07</mn><mfenced><mn>7</mn></mfenced></msup></mfenced><mi>t</mi></msup></mrow><annotation encoding="application/vnd.wiris.mtweb-params+json">{"digitSeparatorsAsMN":"auto"}</annotation></semantics></math>

topic.text: 2.5: Exponential Function Context and Data Modeling

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
